Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: UTXOs take space.   1 M arrr is the same spave as 1 arrrr.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So if too many UTXO's are present it will take far too long to execute and sometimes it will fail.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So sending small amounts at a time will combine them all into one utxo.

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: Is the combine option new user friendly?

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: Think of a UTXO like a dollar bill but with varying denominations.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: If you have 1000 bills its harder to move than 1 or 2.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Just like 100 $1 dollar bills take up much more physical volume than 1 $100 bill, 100 1ARRR UTXOs take up a lot more kilobytes of space in a transaction, than 1 100ARRR UTXO.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and a transaction is like an envelope. You can only fit so much physical money/space in an envelope, and there is a max size (in kilobytes) for a transaction

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: This is why setting your mining payout as high as you can deal with, is good for your wallet and making the funds easier to use, without sweeping many small utxos into larger ones

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: This is also why you shouldnâ€™t mine to exchanges.  ğŸ‘
